title: Falsifying business records in the second degree
text:
§ 175.05 Falsifying business records in the second degree.

A person is guilty of falsifying business records in the second degree
when, with intent to defraud, he:

1. Makes or causes a false entry in the business records of an
enterprise; or

2. Alters, erases, obliterates, deletes, removes or destroys a true
entry in the business records of an enterprise; or

3. Omits to make a true entry in the business records of an enterprise
in violation of a duty to do so which he knows to be imposed upon him by
law or by the nature of his position; or

4. Prevents the making of a true entry or causes the omission thereof
in the business records of an enterprise.

Falsifying business records in the second degree is a class A
misdemeanor.

variables.name: action
variables.description: The action taken on the business records

consequences: Guilty of falsifying business records in the second degree

title: Falsifying business records in the first degree
text:
§ 175.10 Falsifying business records in the first degree.

A person is guilty of falsifying business records in the first degree
when he commits the crime of falsifying business records in the second
degree, and when his intent to defraud includes an intent to commit
another crime or to aid or conceal the commission thereof.

Falsifying business records in the first degree is a class E felony.

variables.name: falsifying_second_degree
variables.description: Indicates if the person has committed falsifying business records in the second degree.

variables.name: intent_to_commit_another_crime
variables.description: Indicates if there is an intent to commit another crime.

variables.name: intent_to_aid_or_conceal
variables.description: Indicates if there is an intent to aid or conceal the commission of another crime.

consequences: Guilty of falsifying business records in the first degree

title: 481.02 UNAUTHORIZED PRACTICE OF LAW.

variables.name: person_type
variables.description: The type of person or entity, e.g., member_of_bar, licensed_attorney, non_member, corporation

variables.name: action
variables.description: The action being performed, e.g., appear_as_attorney, give_legal_advice, prepare_legal_documents

consequences: Unlawful to perform legal actions without being a licensed attorney or member of the bar.

variables.name: corporation_type
variables.description: The type of corporation, e.g., for_profit, non_profit

variables.name: corporation_exception
variables.description: Exception status of the corporation, e.g., attorney_professional_firm

variables.name: action
variables.description: The action being performed, e.g., maintain_court_action, give_legal_advice, prepare_legal_documents

consequences: Unlawful for for-profit corporations to perform legal actions unless they are attorney professional firms.

variables.name: person_type
variables.description: The type of person or entity, e.g., non_attorney, licensed_attorney

variables.name: action
variables.description: The action being performed, e.g., charge_attorney_fee

variables.name: fee_recipient
variables.description: The recipient of the attorney fee, e.g., licensed_attorney, non_licensed_person

consequences: Unlawful to charge attorney fees unless the recipient is a licensed attorney.
